instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
Hi Guys,

PPBUS_G3H = 8.56V
PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H = 3.28V
PPVBUS_E85 = 20.4V
PPDCIN_G3H = 20.4 (logical)
PP3V3_G3H = 3.29V
PP3V3R3V0_AON = 3.25V
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.3V
PP5V_G3H_LDO = 4.97V
PP5V_S4 = 4.99V
PP5V_S0 = 4.97V
PP3V3_S5 = 3.3V
PP3V3_SUS = 3.3V

PP3V3_S4 = PULSING Between 3.3 and 0

PP3V3_S0 = 3.3V
PP1V8_S3 = 1.8V
PP1V5_S0 = 1.5V
PP1V2_S3 = 1.2V
PP1V05_SUS = 1.06V


Also i found something called a "Matt Card" on the board.. What the he** is this ?..


Guys Help me out

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
I suppose PM_SLP_S5_L is steady high.
In such case, change U8000.
Just in case, test first disconnecting trackpad (J4801).

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
Yep - PM_SLP_S5_L always 3.3V - so I need to change U8000?

Maybe you know the Part designation ?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: As the schematic notation, TPS22924; easy to find in many Apple scrap boards.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
which voltage did inform you about the "always high state" of this rail ?

Or better said - how did you know?
And this voltage should only be high if "on Button" is pressed?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
Only S5 power rails appear before pressing power button; when charger is connected, of course.
S4/3/0 voltages require to start the machine with power button.

As you get stable S3/0 voltages, S4 ones shouldn't pulse, must be steady high too.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
So if I understand you correctly, the S4/3/0 Power Rails shouldn't be present if no button is pressed ?

And if they are, U8000 could be faulty as its giving out these Lines ?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: First time when charger is connected, board should automatically turn on; no need to press power button.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
So again - Just to understand for me please..

Why isnt it okay then If S5 is present?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: Who said that???

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 69690, member: 682"]
I suppose PM_SLP_S5_L is steady high.
In such case, change U8000.
[/QUOTE]

I thought this is ment to be not to be okay

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: S5 state MUST be achieved once charger is connected; no matters board is on, or off.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
Well.. this is the case..
World be almost impossible if S0 is there and S5 isnt right ?

So why do you think U8000 is the problem ?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: Because you have stable S3/0 voltages, but pulsing S4 voltage from U8000 output.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: Thanks in advance ! Appreciate your help man ?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: PP3V3_S4 is 2.06V not pulsing anymore.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
The other S3 and S0 voltages present?
Possibly bad solders at U8000.
Post diode mode (red probe at ground) for 3V3_S4.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
PP5V_S0 - 4.98V
PP3V3_S0 -3.30V
PP1V8_S3 - 1.806V
PP1V5_S0 - 1.517V
PP1V05_S0  - 1.056V
PPVCC_S0_CPU - 1.709V

PP3V3_S4 to Ground 0.32V
Ohms Mode on C7830 to ground is 44.8kOhm

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
As you said - i will change U8000 - ordered my Donor Board today as my last one is almost empty :D

BTW:
PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H changed to 20.5V is this normal ?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
Why do you bother with USB-C input, if already got S3 and S0 voltages?
20.5V is good voltage, no problem.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: Shoudnt PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H be 3.3V

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: Not at all, it is an VIN voltage!!!

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 69919, member: 682"]
Not at all, it is an VIN voltage!!!
[/QUOTE]

thanks !!!

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: Okay - changed U8000 now -  3V3_S4 is stable now but still no power on..

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
Any S3 voltage present, or pulsing at least?

Please, STOP to quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
Do not confuse turned on board with working board!
Your board turns on at least.
Check now if you get S0 voltages, especially VCORE.
If present, check for USB activity.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
PP5V_S0 = 4.99V
PP3V3_S0 = 3.29V
PP1V5_S0 = 1.516V
PP1V05_S0 = 1.054V
PP3V3_S0SW_SSD = 3.29V
PPVCC_S0_CPU = 1.706V

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: So VCORE is present, did you check for USB activity?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: How should i do this if there is only one USB Port ?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: Of course, use the battery...

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
The battery is not charged.. Is there a possible way to charge it outside the Mac ? Like externally ?
I think the battery is dead maybe ?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: In such case you need an USB-C hub with power port and USB 3 output.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: Okay but this doesn't solve the problem, that the Screen still stays black right ?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
You need to confirm USB activity first, to know if board boots.
No reason to search video on a turned on board, but not booted.

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message:
Okay I will order such an USB Hub and inform you further :)

But if the Board Doesn't boot - what could cause such a Problem ?

threads.title: A1534 "DeadCPUBook" 820-00045A Board doesnt turn on
threads.message: Bad CPU usually; common issue for these boards.
